text: How do I setup a Python development environment on Linux?
I'm a .NET developer who knows very little about Python, but want to give it a test drive for a small project I'm working on.
What tools and packages should I install on my machine?
I'm looking for a common, somewhat comprehensive, development environment.
I'll likely run Ubuntu 9.10, but I'm flexible.
If Windows is a better option, that's fine too.
EDIT: To clarify, I'm not looking for the bare minimum to get a Python program to run.
I wouldn't expect a newbie .NET dev to use notepad and a compiler.
:)  I'd recommend Visual Studio, NUnit, SQL Server, etc.
